result.execSummary:
The defendant ANTHONY J.R. GARCIA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Reconsideration for Conditional Jail Time Credit Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 973.155
DENIED - Inmate Request to the Court
DENIED - Inmate Request to the Court
Restitution Check sent to the victim has been returned. Return to sender. Re-sent to address provided by the USPS.

3:01 PM Defendant ANTHONY J.R. GARCIA appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ANTHONY J.R. GARCIA. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Corut goes over right to appear in person and with his attorney. Defendant requests to talk with his attorney. Court will put the parties into a break out room. Off the record at 3:02 PM. Back on the record at 3:07 PM Appearances remain the same. Defendant was able to talk with his attorney. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Atty Kapelis has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions. State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions. Sentencing recommendation by DA Laspisa. Sentencing recommendation by Atty Kapelis. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

Ct 1 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 5 years.
Ct 3 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.
Ct 5 - SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.

CONDITIONS:  

-Ct 1 - 6 months of county jail. No huber. Court has no objection to out of county service.
-Court costs. 
Ct 1 -Restitution - $1,816.46.
-No Contact with Jaster's and Wayside.Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. 
-AODA and any follow-up. 
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment and follow-up as recommended. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court orders the cash bond on file be applied first to the restitution, then to the court costs and any balance be refunded to the poster.

Court grants the defendant 37 days of sentence credit if revoked.

Court adjourned at 3:22 PM

AFTER COURT - Court orders the jail sentence to commence immediately.
Letter to Judge Slate from the defendant
letter from Columbia County Drug Treatment Court to defendant, dated 6/22/2022
Sentencing hearing on July 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:01 PM Defendant ANTHONY J.R. GARCIA appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for ANTHONY J.R. GARCIA. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to Burglary as repeater, Theft as repeater and BJ as misdemeanor with probation and conditions and the other counts will be dismissed and read-in. DA concurs. Atty Kapelis concurs. Defendant concurs. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing via zoom. Court goes over right to be in court with his attorney or a break-out room.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1, 3 & 5 as charged and orders counts 2 & 4 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Court orders a pre-sentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court. Upon filing, copies to be disbursed and matter to be set for sentencing. Statement by DA Laspisa regarding charges in Marquette County. State requests bond be revoked in this case. Statement by Atty Kapelis. Court leaves bond as is.


Court adjourned at 2:13 PM

Court sets for Sentencing on July 26, 2022 at 3:30 PM (1/2 hr)
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely

9:25 AM Defendant ANTHONY J.R. GARCIA appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for ANTHONY J.R. GARCIA, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and waives the right to a preliminary hearing.. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court notes bond has been set. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond. Court denies bond modification request. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court with a copy to Attorney Kapelis and is the same as the criminal complaint. Attorney Kapelis acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return date April 18, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:29 AM.
Atty Michael Kapelis
